p: About 80% of infections are asymptomatic, thus, posing a diagnostic dilemma and a barrier to the prevention of disease transmission.[ 55] In general, clinical symptoms appear within 3–12 days of insect bite and resolves in 2–7 days.[ 31] About 20% of cases present with mild, bizarre, self-limiting manifestations, mimicking other arbovirus infections, thus delaying the accurate diagnosis and treatment protocol.[ 56]
